If you are done the exam, click here to checkout. Only checkout once to remove your quiz access.

text.p: Write a function, called lengths, that takes as input a non-empty list, L, of strings and ints. It returns a list where its elements are:

ul.li: the length of the string, if the element in L is a string
the number of digits in the integer, if the element in L is an int

text.p:
For example,
lengths(['a', 'abcd', 'ab', 34]) returns [1, 4, 2, 2]
lengths(['a', 'abcd', 'ab', -34]) returns [1, 4, 2, 2]
text.pre: def lengths(L): """ L, non-empty list of strings and ints Returns a list where its elements are: the length of the string, if the element in L is a string the number of digits in the integer, if the element in L is an int """ #YOUR CODE HERE
text.p: Paste your entire function, including the definition, in the box below. Do not leave any print statements.
